    private java.util.List<Ray> multVecs​(Ray orig, double radius)
    multVecs we make a list of rays that start at the rays start and they finish in a circle we get a ray and we find its first intesection if it doesnt exist we make it a point far away we then make a perpandicular vec and run in a loop each time creating a ray from our starting point to the edge of the ray which rotates around our main ray and we make its length be equal to the radius then we add the original ray we then send back the list of all the rays
    private Vector perVec​(Vector v)

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint intersection, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      we calculate more of the color we add the emission of the point and its local affects then if there are more levels to go down to, we go down to the global effects
      Parameters:
      intersection - -the first intersection
      ray - - the actual ray
      level - -the level we are at of the light bouncing
      k - - we dont care anymore
      Returns:
      a color with the result of the func for the local things

      here we calculate all the local things that will change the pixals color
      Parameters:
      intersection - -the first intesection
      ray - -the ray
      k - - where we dont care anymore
      Returns:
      -a color

    • calcSpecular

      public Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, Vector v, int nShininess, Color lightIntensity)
      adds specular from a particular light source
      Parameters:
      ks - - the variable that defines the amount of specular in an object
      l - - the vector that is from the light source to the object
      n - - the normal vector
      v - - the camera vector
      nShininess - -it changes the shininess so the bigger it is the smaller the specular dot will be
      lightIntensity - - the light intensity at the point
      Returns:
      - a color that took in to account the specular from a specific object

    • calcDiffusive

      public Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, Vector l, Vector n, Color lightIntensity)
      adds deffusion to the pixel from a particular light
      Parameters:
      kd - -the variable that defines the amount of diffuse in an object
      l - - the vector that is from the light source to the object
      n - - the normal vector
      lightIntensity - - the light intensity at the point
      Returns:
      - the color with the deffusion from a specific light source

    • CalcDiffGloEff

      public Color CalcDiffGloEff​(Ray r, int level, double kX, double kkx, double XRad)
      calcs the color for each ray and calculates the average it gets a ray and it uses the global radius to send off to get the list of rays then for each one it determines its color and adds it to factor which calculates an average we also get a bunch of things to pass on
      Parameters:
      r - the original ray
      Returns:

    • multVecs

      private java.util.List<Ray> multVecs​(Ray orig, double radius)
      multVecs we make a list of rays that start at the rays start and they finish in a circle we get a ray and we find its first intesection if it doesnt exist we make it a point far away we then make a perpandicular vec and run in a loop each time creating a ray from our starting point to the edge of the ray which rotates around our main ray and we make its length be equal to the radius then we add the original ray we then send back the list of all the rays
      Parameters:
      orig -
      radius -
      Returns:
      a list of rays

      l - - the vector that is from the light source to the object
      n - - the normal vector
      geopoint -
      Returns:
      - bool that tells us if the geopoint is shaded or not

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(LightSource light, Vector l, Vector n, Intersectable.GeoPoint geopoint)
      checks how transparent the pixel is

      l - - the vector that is from the light source to the object
      n - - the normal vector

      calculates the global effects on this pixel
      Parameters:
      gp - - the point
      v -
      level - - the bouncing level we are at right now
      k - - the number that we count as negligble
      Returns:
      -the color of the pixel with regard to its global effects
